medical_history.chief_complaint: Retinal hemorrhages and subdural hematomas after minor trauma in children with type I osteogenesis imperfecta.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began after falls: Patient 1 fell from his bed and developed seizures immediately; Patient 2 fell from a bed; Patient 3 fell down stairs. Symptoms included seizures in Patients 1 and 3, and retinal hemorrhages were observed during ophthalmologic evaluations.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient 1 diagnosed with osteogenesis imperfecta (OI) at 4 months old, had a history of stress fractures. Patient 2 had a previous hospitalization for a fractured femur at 2 weeks old. Patient 3 had a strong family history of type I OI. The overall report did not mention any other chronic illnesses or surgeries.
medical_history.family_history: Family history significant for multiple affected members with type I OI, including the mother of Patient 1.
